messages.title: IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT FOR TENANTS
messages.content: Labour's plan for better council homes.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour's plan includes a £200 million investment to upgrade run-down homes across the country, with tenants in Lambeth potentially receiving new kitchens and bathrooms within the next three months. Labour has secured government funding to lessen rents, promising to trim £100 off council tax bills and doubting the Lib Dems' ability to deliver on social plans.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The upcoming elections on Thursday 6 May are positioned as crucial for better homes and lower costs, with a reference to rejecting the Lib Dems for three years and crumbling homes.

housing.content: Labour's commitment to invest in home improvements aims to support growing families and assists everyone in living in a decent home. The plan challenges the Lib Dems' capacity to fulfill their social promises.

contactInformation.address: SDP 8a Gateway House, St George's Way, SE15 6HR

images.caption: Image of 'Thornton Labour action team' featuring Chuka Umunna, Cllr Diana Morris, Cllr Lib Peck, and Ed Davie.
